subject: Data
title: The Birth of SQL: A Language for Data
description: A fast breakdown of The Birth of SQL: A Language for Data for builders.

hook.text: Before SQL, querying a database required writing complex programs. SQL let you ask questions in near-English.

buildup.text: IBM researchers developed SEQUEL (later SQL) in the 1970s to implement Codd's relational model.

discovery.text: SELECT name FROM customers WHERE city = 'Paris' â€” SQL made database queries readable by non-programmers.

twist.text: Oracle, not IBM, released the first commercial SQL database in 1979 â€” beating IBM to market with IBM's own idea.

climax.text: SQL became the universal language of data, spoken by every major database system for 50 years.

punchline.text: SQL turned data questions into sentences anyone could read.
